title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 826.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 826.1 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) The term tariff
as used herein is construed to mean a publication stating the rates, charges, classification ratings, rules and regulations (or any of them) of a common
carrier or carriers. (b) The term
local rate as used herein is construed to mean a rate that applies over the
lines or routes of one carrier only. Local tariffs are those that contain only
local rates. (c) The term joint
rate as used herein is construed to mean a rate that applies over the lines of
two or more carriers, and that is made by arrangement or agreement between such
carriers as evidenced by concurrence or power of attorney. Joint tariffs are
those that contain only joint rates. (d) The term proportional rate as used herein
is construed to mean a rate to be used only as a factor in constructing through
rates to or from points beyond the line of a carrier on traffic, the character
of which or on which the unit of weight is not changed en route. Proportional
tariffs are those that contain only proportional rates. (e) The term commodity rate as used herein is
construed to mean a rate on a commodity or commodities specifically named or
described in the tariff publishing such rate, or in a tariff containing a list
of such commodities when reference is made to such tariff. Commodity tariffs
are those that contain only commodity rates. (f) The term class rate as used herein is
construed to mean a rate that applies on any one or more of various articles
assigned to a class in the classification of articles in the class rate tariff, or in a classification or in a tariff of exceptions to a classification. Class
rate tariffs are those that contain only class rates. (g) (1)

The
term classification as used herein is construed to mean a publication
containing a list of articles or commodities and the class rating assigned
thereto for the purpose of applying class rates, together with governing rules
and regulations. (2)

When tariffs
contain two or more types of rates, the title page shall so indicate. For
example, a tariff containing class and commodity rates applying locally over
the line of the carrier shall be designated "tariff of local class and
commodity rates", etc. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
826.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
